message_1: A stream cipher uses a key stream of length 10 to encrypt a plaintext message. If the plaintext message is 45 characters long, what is the length of the resulting cipher text?
message_2: The length of the resulting cipher text in a stream cipher is equal to the length of the plaintext message. So, if the plaintext message is 45 characters long, the resulting cipher text will also be 45 characters long.
